intro: Clidemia fulva, commonly known as the yellow mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as tropical forests and can reach heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are usually opposite, ovate, and have a glossy appearance. Clidemia fulva is also known for its ability to thrive in disturbed habitats, making it a common sight in secondary growth areas.
